Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in refusing Mr. Randhawa's work permit application
Evidence_Type: Applicant's qualifications, training, employer's intent to train
Evaluation_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe applicant cannot perform required work
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Visa officer imposed personal standards without objective evidence
Application_Error: Failure to consider relevant experience and training; reliance on subjective hygiene concerns
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, application referred to another officer for re-determination
Assessment_Standard: Objective reasonableness in evaluating applicant's ability
Evidence_Ignored: Mr. Randhawa's experience, training, and employer's willingness to provide training
Cause_of_Refusal: Concerns about ability to maintain hygiene standards
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of objective evidence supporting hygiene concerns
Procedural_Fairness: Officer failed to apply fair and objective assessment
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on unreasonableness and procedural unfairness
